sen.j: 託基皇女（たきのひめみこ 686年以前? - 天平勝宝3年1月25日 (旧暦)（751年2月25日））は、飛鳥時代・奈良時代の皇族。
sen.e: Taki no himemiko (before 686? to March 1, 751) was a member of the imperial family who lived from the Asuka peirod to the Nara period.
sen.cmt: 天平勝宝3年1月25日 ：西暦751年3月1日となるようです。http://maechan.net/kanreki/
sen.e: Taki no himemiko (before 686? - March 1, 751) was a member of the imperial Family who lived from the Asuka peirod to the Nara period.
sen.cmt: カッコ内を修正しました。Imperial family→Imperial Family と修正しました。
sen.e: Taki no himemiko (before 686? - March 1, 751) was a member of the imperial Family who lived from the Asuka peirod to the Nara period.

sen.j: 天武天皇の皇女で、母は宍人臣大麻呂の娘、かじ媛娘。
sen.e: Her father was the Emperor Tenmu, and her mother was Kajihime no iratsume, who was a daughter of SHISHIUDOOMI no Omaro.
Her father was the Emperor Tenmu, and her mother was Kajihime no iratsume, who was a daughter of SHISHIUDOOMI no Omaro.
Her father was the Emperor Tenmu, and her mother was Kajihime no iratsume, who was a daughter of SHISHIUDOOMI no Omaro.
She was a saigu (the ancient imperial princesses serving at the Ise-jingu Shrine).
She was a saigu (the ancient imperial princesses serving at the Ise-jingu Shrine).
She was a saigu (the ancient imperial princesses serving at the Ise-jingu Shrine).

sen.j: 多紀・当耆皇女とも、大宝律令施行後は多紀・当耆内親王とも記述される。
sen.e: 託基皇女 is also written as 多紀/当耆皇女, or 多紀/当耆内親王 after the enforcement of the Taiho Ritsuryo (Taiho Code).
sen.cmt: 漢字そのものが取りざたされています。
sen.e: 託基皇女 is also written as 多紀/当耆皇女, or 多紀/当耆内親王 after the enforcement of the Taiho Ritsuryo (Taiho Code).
託基皇女 is also written as 多紀/当耆皇女, or 多紀/当耆内親王 after the enforcement of the Taiho Ritsuryo (Taiho Code).

sen.j: 志貴皇子の正妃となり春日王を生む。
sen.e: She became the lawful wife of Prince Shiki, and gave birth to Prince Kasuga.
She became the lawful wife of the Prince Shiki, and gave birth to the Prince Kasuga.
She became the lawful wife of the Prince Shiki, and gave birth to the Prince Kasuga.

sen.j: 天武15年（686年）4月27日、父天皇の病平癒祈願のため大蕤娘らと一緒に伊勢神宮に遣わされる。
sen.e: On May 27, 686, she was sent to the Ise-jingu Shrine with Onuno iratsume to pray for the recovery of the Emperor who was her father.
sen.cmt: 天武15年（686年）4月27日：西暦686年5月27日となるようです。http://maechan.net/kanreki/
sen.e: On May 27, 686, she was sent to the Ise-jingu Shrine with Onuno iratsume to pray for the recovery of the emperor, who was her father.
sen.cmt: Emperor→emperor と修正しました。カンマを補いました。
sen.e: On May 27, 686, she was sent to the Ise-jingu Shrine with Onuno iratsume to pray for the recovery of the emperor, who was her father.

sen.j: 文武2年（698年）9月10日、伊勢斎宮にト定され伊勢へ下向する。
sen.e: On October 22, 698, she was designated an Ise Saigu (an unmarried princess serving at the Ise-jingu Shrine) by fortune telling and left the capital to Ise.
sen.cmt: 文武2年（698年）9月10日：西暦698年10月22日となるようです。http://maechan.net/kanreki/
sen.e: On October 22, 698, she was designated an Ise Saigu (an unmarried princess serving at the Ise-jingu Shrine) by fortune telling and left the capital to Ise.
On October 22, 698, she was designated an Ise Saigu (an unmarried princess serving at the Ise-jingu Shrine) by fortune telling and left the capital to Ise.

sen.j: 斎王制度は大伯皇女が朱鳥元年（686年）に退下したあと途絶えており、12年ぶりの卜定だった。
sen.e: The saio system was discontinued after Oku no himemiko had resigned in 686, and it was the designation by fortune telling for the first time in 12 years.
The saio system had been discontinued after Oku no himemiko resigned in 686, and it was the designation by fortune telling for the first time in 12 years.
sen.cmt: was→had been,had resigned→resigned と修正しました。
sen.e: The saio system had been discontinued after Oku no himemiko resigned in 686, and it was the designation by fortune telling for the first time in 12 years.

sen.j: 文武5年（701年）2月、突如新たに泉皇女が斎王に卜定され、当耆皇女は退下した。
sen.e: In March 701, Izumi no himemiko was suddenly designated a new saio by fortune telling, on which occasion Taki no himemiko resgined.
sen.cmt: 文武5年（701年）2月：西暦701年3月18日となるようです。http://maechan.net/kanreki/
sen.e: In March 701, Izumi no himemiko was suddenly designated a new saio by fortune telling, on which occasion Taki no himemiko resgined.
In March 701, Izumi no himemiko was suddenly designated a new saio by fortune telling, on which occasion Taki no himemiko resgined.

sen.j: 再び慶雲3年（706年）12月6日に伊勢神宮に遣わされている。
sen.e: On January 18, 707, she was sent to the Ise-jingu Shrine for the second time.
sen.cmt: 慶雲3年（706年）12月6日：西暦707年1月18日となるようです。http://maechan.net/kanreki/
sen.e: On January 18, 707, she was sent to the Ise-jingu Shrine for the second time.
On January 18, 707, she was sent to the Ise-jingu Shrine for the second time.

sen.j: 志貴皇子とは斎宮退下後に結婚したものと思われる。
sen.e: It is likely that she married Prince Shiki after she resigned from saigu.
It is likely that she married the Prince Shiki after she resigned from saigu.
It is likely that she married the Prince Shiki after she resigned from saigu.

sen.j: 霊亀2年（716年）夫 志貴皇子の死別後、天平9年（737年）2月14日三品、天平勝宝元年（749年）4月14日一品に昇進。
sen.e: After Prince Shiki, who was her husband, died in 716, she was promoted to the rank of Sanbon on March 23, 737, and to the rank of Ippon on May 8, 749.
sen.cmt: 天平9年（737年）2月14日：西暦737年3月23日天平勝宝元年（749年）4月14日：西暦749年5月8日となるようです。http://maechan.net/kanreki/
sen.e: After the Prince Shiki, who was her husband, died in 716, she was promoted to the rank of Sanbon on March 23, 737, and to the rank of Ippon on May 8, 749.
After the Prince Shiki, who was her husband, died in 716, she was promoted to the rank of Sanbon on March 23, 737, and to the rank of Ippon on May 8, 749.

sen.j: 奈良時代を通じて内親王で一品に昇進したのは彼女と元正天皇の2人だけである（以後、貞観 (日本)19年（877年）の儀子内親王が叙されるまで内親王の一品叙位の例は無い）。
sen.e: Among Imperial Princesses, she and the Empress Gensho were the only ones who were promoted to the rank of Ippon over the Nara period (no Imperial Princesses were promoted to the rank of Ippon thereafter, until Imperial Princess Gishi was granted the rank in 877).

Among those imperial princesses, she and the Empress Gensho were the only ones who were promoted to the rank of Ippon over the Nara period (No imperial princesses were promoted to the rank of Ippon thereafter, until the Imperial Princess Gishi was conferred the rank in 877.)
sen.cmt: those, the を補いました。Imperial Princesses→imperial princesses,granted→conferred,カッコ内、ピリオドの位置を修正しました。
sen.e: Among those imperial princesses, she and the Empress Gensho were the only ones who were promoted to the rank of Ippon over the Nara period (No imperial princesses were promoted to the rank of Ippon thereafter, until the Imperial Princess Gishi was conferred the rank in 877.)

sen.j: これは当時既に天武天皇の子女の中で彼女が最後の生存者になっていたために格別な敬意が払われたものとされている。
sen.e: It is said that she was granted the rank as a token of special respect to her, who was the only living child of the Emperor Tenmu at the time.
It is said that she was granted the rank as a token of special respect to her, who was the only living child of the Emperor Tenmu at the time.
It is said that she was granted the rank as a token of special respect to her, who was the only living child of the Emperor Tenmu at the time.

sen.j: 慶雲2年（705年）4月11日兄忍壁皇子が、天平13年（741年）3月28日姉泊瀬部皇女が死亡するが、天武天皇の子女の中ではもっとも長生きし、当耆皇女自身は天平勝宝3年（751年）1月25日に死亡した。
sen.e: After Osakabe no miko (Prince Osakabe), who was her older brother, died on April 11, 705, and Hatsusebe no himemiko, who was her older sister, died on April 22, 741, she died on March 1, 751, as the child who lived the longest among the children of the Emperor Tenmu.
sen.cmt: 慶雲2年（705年）4月11日：西暦705年5月12日天平13年（741年）3月28日：西暦741年4月22日となるようです。http://maechan.net/kanreki/
sen.e: After Osakabe no miko (the Prince Osakabe), who was her older brother, died on May 12, 705, and Hatsusebe no himemiko, who was her older sister, died on April 22, 741, she died on March 1, 751, as the child who lived the longest among the children of the Emperor Tenmu.
sen.cmt: the を補いました。April 11→May 12 と修正しました。
sen.e: After Osakabe no miko (the Prince Osakabe), who was her older brother, died on May 12, 705, and Hatsusebe no himemiko, who was her older sister, died on April 22, 741, she died on March 1, 751, as the child who lived the longest among the children of the Emperor Tenmu.
